Plays > The Love Suicides at Amijima

– Click image to view.

The Love Suicides at Amijima

(心中天網島) (Shinjū ten no Amijima)

Written By: Chikamatsu Monzaemon (近松門左衛門)

First Staged: 1720

Reference: Major Plays of Chikamatsu, translated by Donald Keene, (New York: Columbia University Press, 1961); Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Kokuritsu Gekijō jōen shiryōshū, edited by Kokuritsu Gekijō Geinō Chōsashitsu, vol. 224, February 1984; Bunraku October 1986 Performance Program

Kashira:

Kōmei (孔明)

Musume (娘)

Hayaku (端役)

Darasuke (陀羅助)

Sanmaime (三枚目)

Fukeoyama (老女形)

Hagataki (端敵)

Baba (sewa) (婆（世話）)

Onna koyaku (女子役)

Decchi (丁稚)

Shūto (舅)

Otoko koyaku (男子役)

Tedai (手代)

Ofuku (お福)

Genta (源太)

Baba (婆)

Shūto (sewa) (舅（世話）)

Performances:

January 1973: The Love Suicides at Amijima

September 1977: The Love Suicides at Amijima

April 1979: The Love Suicides at Amijima

February 1981: The Love Suicides at Amijima

October 1983: The Love Suicides at Amijima

February 1984: The Love Suicides at Amijima

October 1986: The Love Suicides at Amijima

February 1987: The Love Suicides at Amijima

November 1992: The Love Suicides at Amijima

February 1993: The Love Suicides at Amijima

November 2000: The Love Suicides at Amijima

March/April 1988 Tour: The Love Suicides at Amijima

February 1996: The Love Suicides at Amijima

Scenes:

The Gay Quarter Gossips (廓噺)

The Mad Woman (笠物狂)

Matasuke's House (又助住家)

Kōjō [announcement/special performance] (口上)

Chikuma River (筑摩川)

Characters:

Jihei (紙屋治兵衛)

Magoemon (粉屋孫右衛門)

Koharu (紀の国屋小春)

Otama (下女お玉)

Tahei (江戸屋太兵衛)

Zenroku (五貫屋善六)

Kawasho proprietor (河庄亭主)

Night watchman (夜回り )

Maid servant (紀の国屋下女子(下女))

Osan (女房おさん)

Gozaemon (舅五左衛門)

Sangoro (丁稚三五郎)

Kantaro (伜勘太郎)

Osue (娘お末)

Osan's mother (おさんの母)

Brothel supervisor (花車)

Courtesan (傍輩女郎)

Dembei (大和屋伝兵衛)

Denkai (伝界坊)

Saibei (紀の国屋才兵衛)
